TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MenuDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner implements class System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider
Public Class MenuDesigner Inherits HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner Implements IDataBindingSchemaProvider
type MenuDesigner = class inherit HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner interface IDataBindingSchemaProvider

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class provides a hierarchical menu Web server control.
In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup and added to the existing markup for the Web page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class provides design-time support for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> controls in a visual designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the templates of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class methods provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method gets the markup that renders a placeholder for the associated control at design time when no markup is otherwise available. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method provides the markup that renders the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control to the design-time data source. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetSampleDataSource%2A> method constructs a sample data source that can be used at design time for the associated control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyMenu` class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu>. The `MyMenu` class is a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu>. The example also derives the `MyMenuDesigner` class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class, and then applies a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute for the `MyMenuDesigner` on the `MyMenu` class.
`The MyMenuDesigner` overrides the following <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> members:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to draw an orange, dotted border around the control to make its extent more visible.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the markup for a placeholder that includes the error message, which is rendered in red, bold text.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> to generate the markup for a placeholder that contains a message indicating that no menu items are defined.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.Initialize%2A> method to throw an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception, if the associated control is not a `MyMenu` object.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/CS/MenuDesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/VB/MenuDesigner.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void DataBind(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl dataBoundControl) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub DataBind (dataBoundControl As BaseDataBoundControl)

Docs.param: The to bind to the design-time data source.
Docs.summary: Binds the associated control to the design-time data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If one of the following conditions is true, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.DataBind%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.Items%2A> property, and then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> base method:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> property is not `null` or an empty string ("").
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property is not `null`.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.Items%2A> collection contains one or more elements.
The `dataBoundControl` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of that control.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDesignTimeHtml () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: A string containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.DataBind%2A> method to bind the design-time data source to the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control, and then the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.GetDesignModeState%2A> method to cause the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control to generate its static-view and dynamic-view markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> returns the markup for the current view. If the current view is not defined, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> base method.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class. The overridden method changes the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control at design time. The example draws an orange, dotted border around the control to make its extent more visible, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.NotSet> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.None> value.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/CS/MenuDesigner.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/VB/MenuDesigner.vb#4)]

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that renders a placeholder for the associated control at design time when no markup is otherwise available.
Docs.returns: A string containing markup text that renders to a placeholder on the design surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method generates the markup for a placeholder that specifies the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control name and a message instructing you to use the collection editor to add items.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class. The overridden method changes the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class at design time. The example generates the markup for a placeholder that includes a message indicating that no menu items are defined for the associated control.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/CS/MenuDesigner.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/VB/MenuDesigner.vb#5)]

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetErrorDesignTimeHtml (e As Exception) As String

Docs.summary: Provides the markup that renders the associated control at design time when an error has occurred.
Docs.returns: A string that contains the markup used to render the associated at design time after an error has occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method generates markup that renders the error design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control as a placeholder that contains the type name, the control name, and messages describing the error.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class. The overridden method changes the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class at design time. The example generates the markup for a placeholder that includes the error message, which is rendered in red, bold text.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/CS/MenuDesigner.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/VB/MenuDesigner.vb#2)]

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable GetSampleDataSource() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetSampleDataSource () As IHierarchicalEnumerable

Docs.summary: Constructs a sample data source to use at design time for the associated control.
Docs.returns: An object implementing the to use as a data source for the associated .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The sample data source that is constructed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.GetSampleDataSource%2A> method has several root menu items with empty paths. This sample data source is used at design time if no menu items are defined for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control and if the menu cannot be bound to a data source.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub Initialize (component As IComponent)

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The visual designer calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of that control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.Initialize%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> class. The overridden method changes the behavior of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class at design time. The example throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception, if the associated control is not a `MyMenu` object.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/CS/MenuDesigner.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner/VB/MenuDesigner.vb#6)]

Docs.exception: *component* is not a or of a class derived from .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.RefreshSchema%2A> method will be called by the design host only if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> property is true.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property TemplateGroups As TemplateGroupCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of template groups for the templates of the associated control.
Docs.value: A containing an element for each template in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property gets a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> base property. It then adds to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> object named "`ItemTemplates`" that contains two <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> objects named "StaticItemTemplate" and "DynamicItemTemplate". The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> to the caller.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property UsePreviewControl As Boolean
protected: virtual property bool UsePreviewControl { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a copy of the associated control or use the control itself to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> object.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer uses the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> object itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control are persisted to the page markup source.

block.para: You can override the property to return or to determine its value based on whether the control is marked with a class level attribute. If the is not overridden, the ignores the .

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
